alert.note: Alert for Bucks (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 28 at 2:57AM EST until December 28 at 5:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Pennsylvania, including the following county, Bucks. * WHEN...Until 900 AM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 256 AM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated earlier heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - For Neshaminy Creek at Langhorne: At 2:15am the stage was 5.41 feet. Flood Stage is 9 feet. ... For Neshaminy Creek at Penns Park: At 2:30am the stage was 13.52 feet. Flood Stage is 13 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
